items.question: What is audio ducking?
items.answer: Audio ducking is a technique that automatically lowers the volume of background music or sound effects when a voiceover is detected, ensuring clarity in spoken content.

items.question: How does the AI determine when to duck audio?
items.answer: The AI analyzes audio levels in real-time, detecting voice frequencies to adjust the volume of background sounds precisely when the voice is heard.

items.question: Can I customize the ducking levels?
items.answer: Yes! You can set specific levels of adjustment for both music and voice to fit your project requirements.

items.question: Is this tool suitable for beginners?
items.answer: Absolutely! Our user-friendly interface makes it easy for anyone to achieve professional sound quality without prior audio editing experience.

items.question: What audio formats are supported?
items.answer: We support various audio formats including MP3, WAV, and AAC, ensuring compatibility with most audio projects.

items.question: Can I use this feature for live events?
items.answer: Yes! The audio ducking feature works well for real-time adjustments during live events, providing optimal audio balance on the fly.

items.question: What kind of projects can benefit from audio ducking?
items.answer: Projects ranging from podcasts, videos, commercials, and live presentations can all benefit from improved sound clarity provided by ducking.

items.question: Is there any post-processing available?
items.answer: Yes! You can apply additional enhancements and effects after ducking your audio for a polished final output.

items.question: How much does it cost to use the audio ducking feature?
items.answer: Our pricing is flexible, allowing you to pay only for the audio processing you conduct with no hidden fees or subscriptions.

items.question: How can I contact support if I need help?
items.answer: Our support team is available via email and live chat for any technical assistance, typically responding within 24 hours.
